vague_description: Determining how long each machine should operate to provide the necessary medicine distribution while minimizing waste.
detailed_description: A patient can be hooked up to two machines to have medicine delivered, machine 1 and machine 2. Machine 1 delivers \param{MedicineHeartMachine1} units of medicine to the heart per minute and \param{MedicineBrainMachine1} units of medicine per minute to the brain. Machine 2 delivers \param{MedicineHeartMachine2} units of medicine per minute to the heart and \param{MedicineBrainMachine2} units of medicine per minute to the brain. In addition, machine 1 creates \param{WasteMachine1} units of waste per minute while machine 2 creates \param{WasteMachine2} units of waste per minute. If at most \param{MaxMedicineHeart} units of medicine can be received by the heart and at least \param{MinMedicineBrain} units of medicine should be received by the brain, how many minutes should each machine be used to minimize the total amount of waste produced?
target_objective: Minimize the total amount of waste produced while delivering medicine
target_constraints: Heart receives at most MaxMedicineHeart units of medicine
Brain receives at least MinMedicineBrain units of medicine
target_parameters: Amount of medicine delivered to the heart per minute by machine 1
Amount of medicine delivered to the heart per minute by machine 2
Amount of medicine delivered to the brain per minute by machine 1
Amount of medicine delivered to the brain per minute by machine 2
Amount of waste produced per minute by machine 1
Amount of waste produced per minute by machine 2
Maximum units of medicine that can be received by the heart
Minimum units of medicine that should be received by the brain
